item.title: Kayleigh add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "He had known the love that is fed on caresses and feeds them; but this passion that was closer than his bones was not to be superficially satisfied." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Kayleigh add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Every atom of your flesh is as dear to me as my own: in pain and sickness it would still be dear." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Kayleigh add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "I had to touch you with my hands, I had to taste you with my tongue; one can't love and do nothing." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Kayleigh add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
Kayleigh add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "To say goodbye is to die a little." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: Kayleigh add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "There is no trap so deadly as the trap you set for yourself." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: Kayleigh add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I have little left in myself -- I must have you. The world may laugh -- may call me absurd, selfish -- but it does not signify. My very soul demands you: it will be satisfied, or it will take deadly vengeance on its frame." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Kayleigh add a quote by Søren Kierkegaard
item.description: "Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom." -- Søren Kierkegaard

item.title: Kayleigh add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "To die would be an awfully big adventure." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Kayleigh add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "And you'll sit beside me, and we'll look, not at visions, but at realities." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Kayleigh add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "She was widely read enough to appreciate my literary wit but not so widely read that she knew my sources. I like that in a woman." -- David Mitchell

item.title: Kayleigh add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Put your ear down close to your soul and listen hard." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Kayleigh add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "A person is, among all else, a material thing, easily torn and not easily mended." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Kayleigh add a quote by Søren Kierkegaard
item.description: "Once you label me you negate me." -- Søren Kierkegaard

item.title: Kayleigh add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "My life amounts to no more than one drop in a limitless ocean. Yet what is any ocean, but a multitude of drops?" -- David Mitchell

item.title: Kayleigh add a quote by Søren Kierkegaard
item.description: "The most common form of despair is not being who you are." -- Søren Kierkegaard

item.title: Kayleigh add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "If I'm a bitch and a fake, is there nobody who will love a bitch and a fake?" -- Graham Greene

item.title: Kayleigh add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "Every limit is a beginning as well as an ending." -- George Eliot
